snippet: “Armor for the Joust of Peace” will be on display at the Great Hall at the Metropolitan Museum of Art to celebrate the arms and armor department’s centennial exhibition.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; the Metropolitan Museum of Art will soon open an exhibition of 16th-century armor; artist David Salle will display works inspired by Thomas Ades’s opera The Tempest in the south lobby of Metropolitan Opera; art dealers Robert Mnuchin and Dominique Levy will split up their Manhattan gallery L&M Arts, but will remain partners in their Venice, Calif, gallery.
lead_paragraph: “Armor for the Joust of Peace” will be on display at the Great Hall at the Metropolitan Museum of Art to celebrate the arms and armor department’s centennial exhibition.

headline.seo: ‘Armor for the Joust of Peace’ at the Met
headline.main: Dusting Off a Horseman for New Battles
